summary.long: Nahum is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: This is the word about Nineveh, the book of the special dream of Nahum the Elkoshite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is a jealous God and One Who punishes. The Lord punishes and is angry. The Lord punishes those who fight against Him. He is angry with those who hate Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is slow to anger and great in power. The Lord will be sure to punish the guilty. The way He punishes is in the strong-wind and storm. The clouds are the dust under His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He speaks sharp words to the sea and makes it dry. He dries up all the rivers. Bashan and Carmel dry up. The flowers of Lebanon dry up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mountains shake because of Him, and the hills melt. The earth is laid waste before Him, the world and everyone in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can stand before His anger? Who can live through the burning of His anger? His anger is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken up by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is good, a safe place in times of trouble. And He knows those who come to Him to be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He will put an end to Nineveh by making a flood flow over it. And He will drive those who hate Him into darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever plan you make against the Lord, He will destroy it. Trouble will not come a second time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like thorns that tie themselves together, like those who are drunk with strong drink. They are destroyed like dry grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From you one has come who makes sinful plans against the Lord, one who talks about sinful things to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Even if they are strong and many, they will be destroyed and pass away. I have brought trouble to you, O Judah, but I will not bring you trouble any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I will break his load off your shoulders and tear off your chains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has said this about you: “You will have no one to carry on your name. I will destroy the false gods and objects of worship from the house of your gods. I will make your grave ready, for you are very sinful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news and speaks of peace! Keep your special suppers, O Judah. Keep your promises. For the sinful one will never come against you again. He is destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who destroys has come against you, O Nineveh. Put men on the battle-walls. Watch the road. Be strong. Be ready for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will make Jacob great again, like the greatness of Israel, even when destroyers have destroyed them and their vine branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The battle-coverings of his strong men are red. His men of war are dressed in red. The war-wagons shine like fire when they are made ready. The cypress spears are waved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The war-wagons race in the streets. They rush through the city. They look like fire and move like lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders are called. They lose their step as they go, and hurry to the wall. The battle-covering is set up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The river gates are opened, and the king’s house falls down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city is laid waste and the people are carried away. Her women servants are crying like doves, beating on their breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nineveh is like a pool, where water runs away. “Stop! Stop!” they cry. But no one turns back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the silver! Take the gold! For there is no end of the riches, every kind of thing of great worth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything has been taken from her! Yes, she is an empty waste! Hearts are melting in fear and knees are knocking! All bodies suffer, and all their faces turn white!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where is the home of the lions, the place where they feed their young, where the male and female and young lions went, with nothing to be afraid of?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lion killed enough for his young, and for his female lions. He filled his home with food, with torn flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am against you,” says the Lord of All. “I will burn up your war-wagons in smoke. A sword will destroy your young lions. I will cut off your food from the land. And the voice of your men who came with news will never be heard again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for the city of blood, full of lies and stolen riches! There is no end of her prizes of war!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise of the whip, the noise of the wheel, running horses and rolling war-wagons!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Horsemen rushing to battle, swords and spears shining, many dead, too many dead bodies to number! They fall over the dead bodies!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this is because of the many sins of the woman who sells the use of her body. She tempts with her beauty and uses witchcraft. She sells nations by her sinful acts, and families by her witchcraft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am against you,” says the Lord of All. “I will lift up your clothing over your face and let the nations see your body. The nations will see your shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will throw dirt on you and make you unclean. People will look at you and see how bad you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who see you will leave you and say, ‘Nineveh is destroyed! Who will have sorrow for her?’ Where can I find anyone to comfort you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you better than Thebes, which is by the Nile River? Water was all around her. The sea kept her safe, for the water was her wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, with too many to number. Put and Lubim were among her helpers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she was taken away to a strange land. She was taken away in chains. Her small children were beaten to death at every street corner. They drew names to see who would get her men of honor. And all her great men were put in chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also will become drunk. You will be hidden. You will look for a safe place from those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All your strong towers are like fig trees with first-fruits. When they are shaken, they fall into the mouth of the one who eats them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your soldiers are all women. The gates of your land are opened wide to those who hate you. Fire destroys your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Store up water to drink when you are shut in by armies! Make your walls stronger! Go into the clay to make more clay blocks for building!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the fire will destroy you. The sword will kill you. It will destroy you like the locust.
Make yourselves as many as the locusts, as many as the flying locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have more traders than the stars of heaven. The locust destroys everything from the land and flies away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your watchmen are like the flying locusts. Your leaders are like clouds of locusts. They stay in the stone walls on a cold day. When the sun rises they fly away and no one knows where they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your shepherds are sleeping, O king of Assyria. Your leaders are lying down. Your people have gone everywhere on the mountains. And there is no one to gather them together again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing can heal your hurt. Your sore cannot be cured. All who hear about you will clap their hands over you. For who has not suffered under your sinful ways again and again?
verses.speaker: Narrator
